newsitem.title: BOSNIA: Two Bosnian Moslems shot dead, federation says.
newsitem.headline: Two Bosnian Moslems shot dead, federation says.

text.p: Two Bosnian Moslems were killed and another was wounded by automatic gunfire in eastern Bosnia on Friday, Moslem-Croat federation authorities said.
The shooting took place near a former front line in a village inhabited by Serbs before the 1992-95 Bosnian war, the federation said.
The NATO-led peacekeeping force said it was investigating the report.
The federation interior ministry said the Moslems were "ambushed" by unidentified gunmen at about 9 a.m. (0700 GMT) as they rode on a tractor on their way to cut firewood in the eastern Sapna region.
Four Bosnians who were travelling along the same road earlier had gone missing, it said.

The ministry said the NATO-led Stabilisation Force (SFOR) must "undertake urgent and energetic measures" to protect the eastern village of Laze, near the boundary between Bosnia's Moslem-Croat federation and Serb entity.
NATO peackeeeping troops patrol a zone of separation between the two territories and all weapons are supposed to be banned from the zone.
Violence erupted along the boundary line in eastern Bosnia last year when Serb authorities tried to block the return of Moslem refugees to their pre-war homes in Serb-controlled territory.
Some Moslems, prevented from going to their homes in Serb territory, have moved into damaged houses in the zone of separation along the former front line.
